quotes.quote: We should begin by setting conscience free. When all men of all religions...shall enjoy equal liberty, property, and an equal chance for honors and power...we may expect that improvements will be made in the human character and the state of society.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: Spiritual freedom is the root of political liberty...As the union between spiritual freedom and political liberty seems nearly inseparable, it is our duty to defend both.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: The liberty enjoyed by the people of these States of worshipping Almighty God, agreable to their consciences, is not only among the choicest of their blessings, but also of their rights.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: Government has no right to hurt a hair of the head of an atheist for his opinions. Let him have a care of his practices.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: Religion is like a pair of shoes.....Find one that fits for you, but don't make me wear your shoes.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: Religious liberty might be supposed to mean that everybody is free to discuss religion. In practice it means that hardly anybody is allowed to mention it.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: There is a difference between exercising religious beliefs and imposing them on others. Our Constitution fiercely protects the former and expressly prohibits the latter.
quotes.author: Joseph Kennedy III

quotes.quote: Religious freedom is too sacred a right to be restricted or prohibited in any degree without convincing proof that a legitimate interest of the state is in grave danger.
quotes.author: Frank Murphy

quotes.quote: Religious fundamentalists are unaware that freedom of religion necessarily brings with it the freedom to mock religion.
quotes.author: Sherman Alexie

quotes.quote: Religious liberty is essential if we are to raise up righteous children. Morally responsible families will not marginalize religious liberty, they will nurture and protect it.
quotes.author: Russell M. Nelson

quotes.quote: Let the pulpit resound with the doctrine and sentiments of religious liberty. Let us hear of the dignity of man’s nature, and the noble rank he holds among the works of God...Let it be known that British liberties are not the grants of princes and parliaments.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods, or no God.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: That religion, or the duty which we owe to our CREATOR, and the manner of discharging it, can be directed only by reason and conviction, not by force or violence; and therefore, all men are equally entitled to the free exercise of religion, according to the dictates of conscience; and that it is the mutual duty of all to practise Christian forbearance, love, and charity; towards each other.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Adam, if ever there were such a man, was created a Deist; but in the mean time let every man follow, as he has a right to do, the religion and the worship he prefers.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: I have ever regarded the freedom of religious opinions and worship as equally belonging to every sect.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Congress should not establish a religion, and enforce the legal observation of it by law, nor compel men to worship God in any Manner contrary to their conscience.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Freedom to practice one's own religion, doesn't mean belittling other religions.
quotes.author: Abhijit Naskar

quotes.quote: The framers of our Constitution meant we were to have freedom of religion, not freedom from religion.
quotes.author: Billy Graham

quotes.quote: Freedom of religion requires not only freeing religion from undue government regulation and interference. It also requires freeing religion from discrimination and from vile acts of hatred and persecution.
quotes.author: William Barr

quotes.quote: Nothing is more dreaded than the national government meddling with religion.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: The imperative of protecting religious freedom was not just a nod in the direction of piety. It reflects the Framers' belief that religion was indispensable to sustaining our free system of government.
quotes.author: William Barr

quotes.quote: Protection of religious freedom means considering the faiths and beliefs of everyone involved.
quotes.author: Mike Quigley

quotes.quote: Religious tolerance is something we should all practice; however, there have been more persecution and atrocities committed in the name of religion and religious freedom than anything else.
quotes.author: Walter Koenig

quotes.quote: The constitutional freedom of religion is the most inalienable and sacred of all human rights.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I am for freedom of religion, and against all maneuvers to bring about a legal ascendancy of one sect over another.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Freedom of religion is one of the greatest gifts of God to man, without distinction of race and color. He is the author and lord of conscience, and no power on earth has a right to stand between God and the conscience.
quotes.author: Philip Schaff

quotes.quote: Freedom of religion does not give you the right to physically or verbally assault people.
quotes.author: Jim C. Hines

quotes.quote: The Religion then of every man must be left to the conviction and conscience of every man: and it is the right of every man to exercise it as these may dictate.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: It [religious freedom] is a fundamental right which shapes the way we interact socially and personally with our neighbors whose religious views differ from our own.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: The ideal of interreligious dialogue, where all men and women, from different religious traditions, can speak to one another without arguing. This is what religious freedom allows.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: While anyone who practices a religion has the right to their own religious truths, it doesn't give them the right to violate the welfare of another human or an animal. So, where necessary, it is the task of the government to intervene and curb the freedom of religion.
quotes.author: Marianne Thieme

quotes.quote: We are a religious nation because we do not have a state religion, because the government guarantees freedom of religion but has no role in religion, because not only do we tolerate our religious differences, we celebrate them.
quotes.author: Geraldine Ferraro

quotes.quote: In pluralistic, democratic societies, there is the freedom to adopt the religion of your choice. This is good. This lets curious people like you run around on the loose!
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Let us preserve freedom. Let us cherish freedom. Freedom of conscience, religious freedom, the freedom of each person, each family, each people, which is what gives rise to rights.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: Religious freedom should work two ways: we should be free to practice the religion of our choice, but we must also be free from having someone else's religion practiced on us.
quotes.author: John Irving

quotes.quote: It's the duty of everyone to defend religious freedom and promote it for all people.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: Religious freedom does not mean freedom from religion.
quotes.author: Rick Perry

quotes.quote: Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances.
quotes.author: Amendment I

quotes.quote: Equal and exact justice to all men...freedom of religion, freedom of the press, freedom of the person under the protection of the habeas corpus; and trial by juries impartially selected – these principles form the bright constellation that has gone before us.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Let me be a free man, free to travel, free to stop, free to work, free to trade where I choose, free to choose my own teachers, free to follow the religion of my fathers, free to talk, think and act for myself — and I will obey every law or submit to the penalty.
quotes.author: Chief Joseph

quotes.quote: Freedom of religion means the right of the individual to choose and to adhere to whichever religious beliefs he may prefer, to join with others in religious associations to express these beliefs, and to incur no civil disabilities because of his choice.
quotes.author: Joseph Leon Blau

quotes.quote: Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Freedom prospers when religion is vibrant and the rule of law under God is acknowledged.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: As a people we will always have disagreements about religion. But that reality cannot be used as an excuse to banish religious activity entirely from public life.
quotes.author: Eric Rassbach

quotes.quote: There is religious freedom under law and religious discrimination laws. You can't be treated differently from others.
quotes.author: Ed Martin

quotes.quote: If the freedom of speech is taken away then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: People demand freedom of speech to make up for the freedom of thought which they avoid.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: A people which is able to say everything becomes able to do everything.
quotes.author: Napoleon I

quotes.quote: Take away freedom of speech, and the creative faculties dry up.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: It is easy to believe in freedom of speech for those with whom we agree.
quotes.author: Leo Mckern

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech includes the freedom to offend people.
quotes.author: Brad Thor

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is useless without freedom of thought.
quotes.author: Spiro Agnew

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is a guiding rule, one of the foundations of democracy, but at the same time, freedom does not imply anarchy, and the right to exercise free expression does not include the right to do unjustified harm to others.
quotes.author: Raphael Cohen-Almagor

quotes.quote: We should not have either a blunt knife or a freedom of speech which is ill-managed.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech gives you the right to stay silent.
quotes.author: Neil Gaiman

quotes.quote: At no time is freedom of speech more precious than when a man hits his thumb with a hammer.
quotes.author: Marshall Lumsden

quotes.quote: We who officially value freedom of speech above life itself seem to have nothing to talk about but the weather.
quotes.author: Barbara Ehrenreich

quotes.quote: To suppress free speech is a double wrong. It violates the rights of the hearer as well as those of the speaker.
quotes.author: Frederick Douglass

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech doesn't protect speech you like; it protects speech you don't like.
quotes.author: Larry Flynt

quotes.quote: Most people do not really want others to have freedom of speech, they just want others to be given the freedom to say want they want to hear.
quotes.author: David Joseph Cribbin

quotes.quote: Don't exercise your freedom of speech until you have exercised your freedom of thought.
quotes.author: Tim Fargo

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech means setting words free. Imprisoned and freed words are consequential. All words have consequences.
quotes.author: John R Dallas Jr

quotes.quote: Free speech carries with it some freedom to listen.
quotes.author: Warren Earl Burger

quotes.quote: Free speech not only lives, it rocks!
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech means that you shall not do something to people either for the views they have, or the views they express, or the words they speak or write.
quotes.author: Hugo L. Black

quotes.quote: Free speech is life itself.
quotes.author: Salman Rushdie

quotes.quote: Without free speech no search for truth is possible... no discovery of truth is useful... Better a thousandfold abuse of free speech than denial of free speech. The abuse dies in a day, but the denial slays the life of the people, and entombs the hope of the race.
quotes.author: Charles Bradlaugh

quotes.quote: I believe in freedom of speech, but I believe we should also have the right to comment on freedom of speech.
quotes.author: Stockwell Day

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is not simply a freedom to think and say what you wish, but to speak for yourself, to speak from the heart, and to be accountable for your words.
quotes.author: Ian Mccallum

quotes.quote: Where there is a great deal of free speech there is always a certain amount of foolish speech.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech doesn't mean freedom from judgement.
quotes.author: Jackson Pearce

quotes.quote: Without freedom of speech there is no modern world, just a barbaric one.
quotes.author: Ai Weiwei

quotes.quote: If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: I'm for the freedom of expression, given that it will be under strict control.
quotes.author: Alan Bennett

quotes.quote: Without freedom of speech, I might be in the swamp.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: Freedom Of Speech Can Be Just As Deadly As The Right To Bear Arms.
quotes.author: Ayjee Grogan

quotes.quote: The right to free speech and the unrealistic expectation to never be offended can not coexist.
quotes.author: Philip Sharp

quotes.quote: Free speech is not to be regulated like diseased cattle and impure butter. The audience...that hissed yesterday may applaud today even for the same performance.
quotes.author: William O. Douglas

quotes.quote: Some people's idea of [free speech] is that they are free to say what they like, but if anyone says anything back, that is an outrage.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Better a thousandfold abuse of free speech than denial of free speech.
quotes.author: Charles Bradlaugh

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech means freedom for those who you despise, and freedom to express the most despicable views. It also means that the government cannot pick and choose which expressions to authorize and which to prevent.
quotes.author: Alan Dershowitz

quotes.quote: WE SHOULD SILENCE ANYONE WHO OPPOSES THE RIGHT TO FREEDOM OF SPEECH.
quotes.author: Boyle Roche

quotes.quote: We have to uphold a free press and freedom of speech -- because, in the end, lies and misinformation are no match for the truth.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.quote: We don't need to control' free speech, we need to control ourselves
quotes.author: Peggy Noonan

quotes.quote: Ignorant free speech often works against the speaker. That is one of several reasons why it must be given rein instead of suppressed.
quotes.author: Anna Quindlen

quotes.quote: We must bring ourselves to realize that it is necessary to support free speech for the things we hate in order to ensure it for the things in which we believe with all our heart.
quotes.author: Heywood Broun

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is the great bulwark of liberty; they prosper and die together: And it is the terror of traitors and oppressors, and a barrier against them. It produces excellent writers, and encourages men of fine genius.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: There is a fine line between free speech and hate speech. Free speech encourages debate whereas hate speech incites violence.
quotes.author: Newton Lee

quotes.quote: Free speech is the cornerstone to every right we have.
quotes.author: Mark Thomas

quotes.quote: Free speech includes the right to not speak.
quotes.author: Jimmy Wales

quotes.quote: Free speech gives us the ability to react vigorously with effective arguments and expose the weakness and misdirection of the other side's claims.
quotes.author: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.quote: It is clear that not in one thing alone, but in many ways equality and freedom of speech are a good thing.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: Being offended by freedom of speech should never be regarded as a justification for violence.
quotes.author: Alan Dershowitz

quotes.quote: We have freedom of speech, but you got to watch what you say.
quotes.author: Tracy Morgan

quotes.quote: Freedom of press and freedom of speech: What a blessing for a country while in the hands of honest, patriotic men; what a curse if in the hands of designing demagogues.
quotes.author: William J.H. Boetcker

quotes.quote: Without free speech no search for truth is possible; without free speech, progress is checked and the nations no longer march forward toward the nobler life which the future holds for a man.
quotes.author: Charles Bradlaugh

quotes.quote: What's the very first step taken by every dictatorship since history has been recorded? The prohibition of free speech, the curbing, and elimination of a free press.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom; and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech; which is the right of every man as far as by it he does not hurt or control the right of another; and this is the only check it ought to suffer and the only bounds it ought to know.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: In our country, we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Without general elections, without freedom of the press, freedom of speech, freedom of assembly, without the free battle of opinions, life in every public institution wither away, becomes a caricature of itself, and bureaucracy rises as the only deciding factor.
quotes.author: Rosa Luxemburg

quotes.quote: I am thankful for all the complaining I hear about our government because it means we have freedom of speech.
quotes.author: Nancie J. Carmody

quotes.quote: The political core of any movement for freedom in the society has to have the political imperative to protect free speech.
quotes.author: Bell Hooks

quotes.quote: We know what works: freedom works. We know what's right: freedom's right. We know how to secure a more and just and prosperous life for man on earth: through free markets, free speech, free elections, and the exercise of free will unhampered by the state.
quotes.author: George Bush

quotes.quote: If we do not believe in freedom of speech for those we despise, we do not believe in it at all.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.quote: In so far as it takes effect at all, pacifist propaganda can only be effective against those countries where a certain amount of freedom of speech is still permitted.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: Free speech is like garlic. If you are perfectly sure of yourself, you enjoy it and your friends tolerate it.
quotes.author: Lynn White Jr

quotes.quote: The most stringent protection of free speech would not protect a man falsely shouting fire in a theater and causing a panic.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech and freedom of action are meaningless without freedom to think. And there is no freedom of thought without a doubt.
quotes.author: Bergen Evans

quotes.quote: Fear of serious injury cannot alone justify the oppression of free speech and assembly. Men feared witches and burnt women. It is the function of speech to free men from the bondage of irrational fears.
quotes.author: Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.quote: Restriction of free thought and free speech is the most dangerous of all subversions. It is the one un-American act that could most easily defeat us.
quotes.author: William O. Douglas

quotes.quote: There is, therefore, no-obligation, in defending or asserting the right to speak, to pass any comment on the truth or merit of what may be, or is being said.
quotes.author: Hitchens

quotes.quote: Civil society means that free expression trumps the emotions of anyone to whom free expression might be inconvenient.
quotes.author: Hitchens

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech and thought matter, especially when it is speech and thought with which we disagree. The moment the majority decides to destroy people for engaging in thought it dislikes thought crime becomes a reality.
quotes.author: Ben Shapiro

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is a human right and the foundation upon which democracy is built. Any restriction of freedom of speech is a restriction upon democracy.
quotes.author: Dheeya Khan

quotes.quote: We have the freedom of speech. We are able to hold hands in protest and stand up for what we believe in and have people hear what we have to say.
quotes.author: Randy Orton

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech is freedom above all for those whose views you dislike most.
quotes.author: Peter Hitchens

quotes.quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
quotes.author: S.G. Tallentyre

quotes.quote: Freedom of speech does not protect you from the consequences of saying stupid shit.
quotes.author: Jim C. Hines

quotes.quote: Whoever would overthrow the liberty of a nation must begin by subduing the freeness of speech.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: What is freedom of expression? Without the freedom to offend, it ceases to exist.
quotes.author: Salman Rushdie

quotes.quote: Everyone is entitled to his own opinion, but not to his own facts.
quotes.author: Daniel Patrick Moynihan

quotes.quote: A choir is made up of many voices, including yours and mine. If one by one all go silent then all that will be left are the soloists. Don't let a loud few determine the nature of the sound. It makes for poor harmony and diminishes the song.
quotes.author: Vera Nazarian

quotes.quote: This is slavery, not to speak one's thoughts.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: If you're not going to use your free speech to criticize your own government, then what the hell is the point of having it?
quotes.author: Michel Templet

quotes.quote: Know the difference, between those who stay to feed the soil and those who come out to grab the fruit.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Givers need to set limits because takers rarely do.
quotes.author: Rachel Wolchin

quotes.quote: A 'free loader' is someone who doesn't pay the mandate tax, but NOT someone who pays no income tax.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Some people will only "love you" as much as they can use you. Their "loyalty" ends where the benefits stop.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Parents do not owe their progeny an inheritance no matter how much money they have. One of the surest ways to produce loafers and freeloaders is to let children know that their future is assured.
quotes.author: Ann Landers

quotes.quote: Some people do just enough to keep you around because they are afraid to know what life would be like without you.
quotes.author: O. S. Hickman

quotes.quote: Behind every great man, there is always somebody asking him for favors.
quotes.author: Juan Largo

quotes.quote: There comes a time when you have to stop crossing oceans for people who wouldn't even jump puddles for you.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Thou shalt not take moochers into thy hut?
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.quote: Unemployment insurance is a pre-paid vacation for freeloaders.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: These kids who never have any accountability for their actions will continue through life thinking nothing is their fault, and everything is owed to them.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Don't let people treat you like cigarette. Use you when they need you and throw you when they're done.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: You see a person's true colors when you are no longer beneficial to their life.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: You can't always be nice. That's how people take advantage of you. Sometimes you have to set boundaries.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: If you allow people to make more withdrawals than deposits in your life, you will be out of balance and in the negative! Know when to close the account.
quotes.author: Christie Williams

quotes.quote: There are people, who the more you do for them, the less they will do for themselves.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: A free-loader is a confirmed guest. He is the man who is always willing to come for dinner.
quotes.author: Damon Runyon

quotes.quote: A gold standard is to the moochers and looters in government what sunlight and garlic are to vampires.
quotes.author: Herman Cain

quotes.quote: He-who-shares-one's-food-but-does-not-share-one's-tasks-is-a-freeloader; he who eats the sweet should also eat the sour.
quotes.author: Yoruba Proverb

quotes.quote: The freeloader always seeks opportunities to take as much as possible from his or her benefactor.
quotes.author: Yoruba Proverb

quotes.quote: A poser and a show-off of the first order. A sponger too, a user of women, a nobility freak, and a little boy lost at the same time.
quotes.author: H.C. Ten Berge

quotes.quote: There are widows made of money / with legacies everywhere / It's a land of milk and honey / with the most freeloader air.
quotes.author: Wallace Dean La Benne

quotes.quote: The relationship between Buyer and Freeloader is a disaster for the Buyer.
quotes.author: Willard F. Harley

quotes.quote: Some people do just enough to keep you around because they are AFRAID to know what life would be like without you.
quotes.author: O.S. Hickman

quotes.quote: You don't want to get beat, number one, and you hate getting shutout, number two, and even worse, no hits.
quotes.author: Dusty Baker

quotes.quote: Masonry is the science of life in a society of men, by signs, symbols and ceremonies; having as its basis a system of morality and for its purpose the perfection and happiness of the individual and the race.
quotes.author: G.F. Moore

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is a science of symbols, in which, by their proper study, a search is instituted after truth, that truth consisting in the knowledge of the divine and human nature of God and the human Soul.
quotes.author: A. G. MacKey

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an institution founded on eternal reason and truth; whose deep basis is the civilization of mankind, and whose everlasting glory it is to have the immovable support of those two mighty pillars, science and morality.
quotes.author: Dr. John Dove

quotes.quote: The strength of Freemasonry is in its loyalty to each other.
quotes.author: Vasilios Karpos

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is founded on the immutable laws of Truth and Justice and its grand object is to promote the happiness of the human race.Â
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: Masonic ideas are the precious jewels of Speculative Masons; the should be kept bright and sparkling for all the brethren to see and to admire. As such, they should be the special care of Masonic leaders particularly those who teach and interpret the philosophy of Freemasonry.
quotes.author: Conrad Hahn

quotes.quote: More than an institution, more than a tradition, more than a society, Masonry is one of the forms of Divine life upon earth.
quotes.author: Joseph Fort Newton

quotes.quote: Masonry was not made to divide men, but to unite them, leaving each man free to think his own thoughts and fashion his own system of ultimate truth. All its emphasis rests upon two extremely simple and profound principles, love of God and love of man.
quotes.author: J. F. Newton

quotes.quote: Masonry aims at the promotion of morality and higher living by the cultivation of the social side of man, the rousing in him of the instincts of charity and love of his kind. It rests surely on the foundation of the brotherhood of man and the fatherhood of God.
quotes.author: William Howard Taft

quotes.quote: Freemasonry embraces the highest moral laws and will bear the test of any system of ethics or philosophy ever promulgated for the uplift of man.
quotes.author: Douglas McArther

quotes.quote: Freemasonry teaches not merely temperance, fortitude, prudence, justice, brotherly love, relief, and truth, but liberty, equality, and fraternity, and it denounces ignorance, superstition, bigotry, lust tyranny and despotism.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an institution calculated to benefit mankind.
quotes.author: Andrew Jackson

quotes.quote: The Masonic Fraternity is one of the most helpful mediating and conserving organizations among men, and I have never wavered from that childhood impression, but it has stood steadfastly with me through the busy, vast hurrying years.
quotes.author: William Howard Taft

quotes.quote: Masonry is an art, useful and extensive, which comprehends within its circle every branch of useful knowledge and learning, and stamps an indelible mark of preeminence on its genuine professors, which neither chance, power, nor fortune can bestow.
quotes.author: William Preston

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an ancient and respectable institution, embracing individuals of every nation, of every religion, and of every condition in life. Wealth, power and talents, are not necessary to the person of a Freemason. An unblemished character and virtuous conduct are the only qualifications for admission in to the Order.
quotes.author: Laurie

quotes.quote: Freemasonry has become the preserver of certain traditions and ideas, but it rarely questions the values and quality of some of these ideas.
quotes.author: Conrad Hahn

quotes.quote: Masonry is one of the most sublime and perfect institutions that ever was formed for the advancement of happiness, and the general good of mankind, creating, in all its varieties, universal benevolence and brotherly love.
quotes.author: Duke of Sussex

quotes.quote: The underlying principle of Masonry is the fatherhood of God and the brotherhood of man. In this war we are engaging in upholding these principles and our enemies are attacking them.
quotes.author: William Howard Taft

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is 'veiled in allegory and illustrated by symbols' because these are the surest way by which moral and ethical truths may be taught. It is not only with the brain and with the mind that the initiate must take Freemasonry but also with the heart.
quotes.author: C. H. Claudy

quotes.quote: Masonry superadds to our other obligations the strongest ties of connection between it and the cultivation of virtue, and furnishes the most powerful incentives to goodness.
quotes.author: DeWitt Clinton

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an order whose leading star is philanthropy and whose principles inculcate an unceasing devotion to the cause of virtue and morality.
quotes.author: Lafayette

quotes.quote: The Brotherhood of Man begins with the Manhood of the Brother.
quotes.author: William N. Ponton

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is â€˜veiled in allegory and illustrated by symbols' because these are the surest way by which moral and ethical truths may be taught. It is not only with the brain and with the mind that the initiate must take Freemasonry but also with the heart.
quotes.author: C. H. Claudy

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is a beautiful system of morality, veiled in allegory, and illustrated by symbols.
quotes.author: Hemming

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an institution essentially philanthropic and progressive, which has for its basis the existence of God and the immortality of the soul. It has for its object the exercise of benevolence, the study of universal morality, and the practice of all the virtues.
quotes.author: Constitution Grand Orient of France

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an establishment founded on the benevolent intention of extending and conferring mutual happiness upon the best and truest principles of moral life and social virtue.
quotes.author: Wellins Calcott

quotes.quote: Freemasonry has promoted fellowship, it has nurtured brotherhood, it has practiced charity. It has education, it has been founded on truth and the cardinal virtues. But what is Masonry's greatest mission in life today? What should be the thrust of modern Masonry? Those are the answers we are presently seeking, and on our success in finding the answer depends the future of our Fraternity.
quotes.author: L. L. Williams

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is a moral order, instituted by virtuous men, with the praiseworthy design of recalling to our remembrance the most sublime truths, in the midst of the most innocent and social pleasures, founded on liberality, brotherly love and charity.
quotes.author: Augustus C.L. Arnold

quotes.quote: Masonry is Friendship, Love, and Integrity â€” friendship which rises superior to the fictitious distinctions of society, the prejudices of religion, and the pecuniary conditions of life; love which knows no limit, nor inequality, nor decay; integrity which binds man to the eternal law of duty.
quotes.author: A.C.L. Arnold

quotes.quote:
Freemasonry is an establishment founded on the benevolent intention
of extending and conferring mutual happiness upon the best
and truest principles of moral life and social virtue.
quotes.author: Wellins Calcott

quotes.quote: Every Masonic Lodge is a temple of religion and its teachings are instruction in religion.
quotes.author: Albert Pike

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is an ancient and respectable institution, embracing individuals of every nation, of every religion, and of every condition in life. Wealth, power and talents are not necessary to the person of a Freemason. An unblemished character and a virtuous conduct are the only qualifications for admission into the Order.
quotes.author: Andrew Jackson

quotes.quote: Masonic labor is purely a labor of love. He who seeks to draw Masonic wages in gold and silver will be disappointed. The wages of a Mason are in the dealings with one another, sympathy begets sympathy, kindness begets kindness, helpfulness begets helpfulness, and these are the wages of a Mason.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: There is no doubt in my mind that Masonry is the cornerstone of America.
quotes.author: Dave Thomas

quotes.quote: Freemasonry embraces the highest moral laws and will bear the test of any system of ethics or philosophy ever promulgated for the uplift of man.
quotes.author: Douglas Macarthur

quotes.quote: One thing and only one thing a Masonic Lodge can give its members which they can get nowhere else in the world. That one thing is Masonry.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: Freemasonry is a Jewish establishment, whose history, grades, official appointments, passwords, and explanations are Jewish from beginning to end
quotes.author: Isaac Mayer Wise

quotes.quote: Women who love the same man have a kind of bitter freemasonry.
quotes.author: Max Beerbohm

quotes.quote: The Masonic fraternity tramples upon our rights, defeats the administration of justice, and bids defiance to every government which it cannot control.
quotes.author: Millard Fillmore

quotes.quote: There is a kinship, a kind of freemasonry, between all persons of intelligence, however antagonistic their moral outlook.
quotes.author: Norman Douglas

quotes.quote: There is the same difference between talent and genius that there is between a stone mason and a sculptor.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.quote: Machinery may make for efficiency and a standardization of life, but horse love is a bond of freemasonry which unites the entire race.
quotes.author: William Fawcett

quotes.quote: The greatest lesson in life is to know that even fools are right sometimes.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Democracy, thus French revolution, was not invented by philosophic theory nor by the bourgeois leadership. It was discovered by the masses in their method of action.
quotes.author: Raya Dunayevskaya

quotes.quote: The French Revolution gave birth to no artists but only to a great journalist, desmoulins, and to an under-the-counter writer, sade. The only poet of the times was the guillotine.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The French Revolution actualised the Enlightenment's greatest intellectual breakthrough: detaching the political from the theocratic.
quotes.author: Pankaj Mishra

quotes.quote: The “terror” of the French Revolution lasted for ten years. The terror that preceded and led to it lasted for a thousand years.
quotes.author: Edward Abbey

quotes.quote: The annals of the French Revolution prove that the knowledge of the few cannot counteract the ignorance of the many.The light of philosophy, when it is confined to a small minority, points out the possessors as the victims rather than the illuminators of the multitude.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote: I shall die in the belief that to make France free, republican and prosperous, a little ink would have sufficed - and only one guillotine.
quotes.author: Camille Desmoulins

quotes.quote: Justice has its anger, my lord Bishop, and the wrath of justice is an element of progress. Whatever else may be said of it, the French Revolution was the greatest step forward by mankind since the coming of Christ. It was unfinished, I agree, but still it was sublime. It released the untapped springs of society; it softened hearts, appeased, tranquilized, enlightened, and set flowing through the world the tides of civilization. It was good. The French Revolution was the anointing of humanity.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: I have often said that just as the French revolution, for instance, understood itself through antiquity, I think our time can be understood through the French revolution. It is quite a natural process to use other times to understand your own time.
quotes.author: Ian Hamilton Finlay

quotes.quote: The french revolution gave rise to ideas which led beyond the ideas of the entire old world order. The revolutionary movement which began in 1789 gave rise to the communist idea which babeu's friend buonarroti re-introduced in france after the revolution of 1830. This idea, consistently developed, is the idea of the new world order.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: The most lasting and universal consequence of the French revolution is the metric system.
quotes.author: Eric Hobsbawm

quotes.quote: The French revolution taught us the rights of man
quotes.author: Thomas Sankara

quotes.quote: The french revolution and the rise of the middle class signaled the end of the harpsichord's popularity. The middle class began attending performance in large concert halls, and a keyboard intrument with a bigger sound that could fill a hall was needed.
quotes.author: kathleen mcintosh

quotes.quote: We need the real, nation wide terror which reinvigorates the country and through which the great French Revolution achieved glory.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.quote: The French Revolution is the ultimate modernist statement. Destroy everything. Don’t build on the past. There is no past.
quotes.author: John Corigliano

quotes.quote: The French Revolution will be found to have had great influence on the strength of parties, and on the subsequent political transactions of the United States.
quotes.author: John Marshall

quotes.quote: The French Revolution ends slavery unilaterally. And it does so at this moment when the British, the Spanish, the Portuguese and the Americans - all of the other major powers - keep slavery. And the fact is that it's almost bankrupting the French Colonial Empire.
quotes.author: Tom Reiss

quotes.quote: The French Revolution was a kind of 21st-century moment in the heart of the 18th century - and Alex Dumas, outstanding though he was, could never have risen the way he did if not for that. The French Revolution was the American Revolution on steroids.
quotes.author: Tom Reiss

quotes.quote: After the French Revolution, it was not the treason of the king that was in question; it was the existence of the king. You have to be very careful when you judge and execute somebody for being a symbol.
quotes.author: Adam Michnik

quotes.quote: What truly makes the French Revolution the first fascist revolution was its effort to turn politics into a religion. (In this the revolutionaries were inspired by Rousseau, whose concept of the general will divinized the people while rendering the person an afterthought.)
quotes.author: Jonah Goldberg

quotes.quote: The french revolution has not received more attention than it deserves; but in comparison disproportionately little attention has been given to the English Civil Wars of the seventeenth century. In a more modest way, these too helped fix the shape of the modern world. Specifically, most of the devices and ideas which have found expression in subsequent constitutions date from the experiments and theories of that day.
quotes.author: Francis D. Wormuth

quotes.quote: The French Revolution was nothing but a precursor of another revolution, one that will be bigger, more solemn, and which will be the last.
quotes.author: Francois-Noel Babeuf

quotes.quote: The French revolution was a machine invented and constructed for the purpose of manufacturing liberty; but it had neither lever cogs, nor adjusting powers, and the consequences were that it worked so rapidly that it destroyed its own inventors, and set itself on fire.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: It was the French Revolution that served as the catalyst of this renovation. Its impact was to make the concept of popular sovereignty the new moral justification for the political system of historical capitalism.
quotes.author: Immanuel Wallerstein

quotes.quote: To be born, or at any rate bred, in a hand-bag, whether it had handles or not, seems to me to display a contempt for the ordinary decencies of family life that reminds one of the worst excesses of the French Revolution.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: It is obvious that the French Revolution was a vaster and more profound social upheaval, involving more violent conflict between classes, more radical reorganization of government and society, more far-reaching redefinition of marriage, property, and civil law as well as of organs of public authority, more redistribution of wealth and income, more fears on the part of the rich and more demands from the poor, more sensational repercussions in other countries, more crises of counterrevolution, war, and invasion, and more drastic or emergency measures, as in the Reign of Terror. From very early in the French Revolution the American Revolution came to seem very moderate.
quotes.author: R. R. Palmer

quotes.quote: There were two, three or four French Revolutions. Like a multi-stage rocket today, the Revolution involved several successive explosions and propellant thrusts.
quotes.author: Fernand Braudel

quotes.quote: The nation-state became powerful in the wake of the French Revolution, whereas the nation-state has become powerless in light of globalization.
quotes.author: Grace Lee Boggs

quotes.quote: The French Revolution printed money because they didn't have any, so they just printed it, and this was a revolutionary step which of course we are still reaping the huge consequences of today. It struck me that this was beginning to happen...there had been scandals where shares had been printed.
quotes.author: Marina Warner

quotes.quote: The French revolution, he concluded, had not produced any new principles of truths, merely a mass of examples of how things could go wrong.
quotes.author: Mike Jay

quotes.quote: The French Revolution had many turning points; but the oath of the clergy was; if not the greatest, unquestionably one of the. It was certainly the Constituent Assembly’s most serious mistake. For the first time, it forced fellow citizens to choose: declare themselves publicly for or against the new order.
quotes.author: William Doyle

quotes.quote: We don't want to be like the leader in the French Revolution who said There go my people, I must find out where they are going so I can lead them.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: A fresh mind keeps the body fresh. Take in the ideas of the day, drain off those of yesterday. As to the morrow, time enough to consider it when it becomes today.
quotes.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
quotes.author: T. S. Eliot

quotes.quote: Each fresh peak ascended teaches something.
quotes.author: Martin Conway, 1st Baron Conway of Allington

quotes.quote: Being fresh is more important than having money.
quotes.author: Kanye West

quotes.quote: Tomorrow is always fresh, with no mistakes in it yet.
quotes.author: L.M. Montgomery

quotes.quote: You can make a fresh start with your final breath.
quotes.author: Bertolt Brecht

quotes.quote: True creativity is fresh, but not always original.
quotes.author: Steven Furtick

quotes.quote: Every fresh morning brings freshness of sacred-being.
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: You have to reinvent to stay fresh, to stay in the game.
quotes.author: Madonna Ciccone

quotes.quote: The fresh start is always an illusion but a necessary one.
quotes.author: Eleanor Clark

quotes.quote: Humility is really important because it keeps you fresh and new.
quotes.author: Steven Tyler

quotes.quote: Continuity does not rule out fresh approaches to fresh situations.
quotes.author: Dean Rusk

quotes.quote: Every day is a fresh beginning, Every morn is the world made new.
quotes.author: Sarah Chauncey Woolsey

quotes.quote: To keep the air fresh among words is the secret of verbal cleanliness.
quotes.author: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.quote: Fresh, solid ideas feel like gifts to writers, therefore every morning is Christmas.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: Fresh air is good if you do not take too much of it; most of the achievements and pleasures of life are in bad air.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.quote: Love is always fresh as morning dew.
quotes.author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.quote: A fresh pair of eyes can often find problems.
quotes.author: Mike Simpson

quotes.quote: One new feature or fresh take can change everything.
quotes.author: Neil Young

quotes.quote: Freshness is essential. That makes all the difference.
quotes.author: Julia Child

quotes.quote: Everybody deserves a fresh start every once in a while.
quotes.author: Bugsy Siegel

quotes.quote: Fresh activity is the only means of overcoming adversity.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Fresh water is like a fossil fuel; we should not waste it.
quotes.author: Walter Munk

quotes.quote: Every fresh acquirement is another remedy against affliction and time.
quotes.author: Robert Aris Willmott

quotes.quote: You don't have to worry about what happened last year; you can start fresh.
quotes.author: D'Brickashaw Ferguson

quotes.quote: A child's world is fresh and new and beautiful, full of wonder and excitement.
quotes.author: Rachel Carson

quotes.quote: Every fresh experience points out some form of error which we shall afterwards carefully avoid.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.quote: Start a painting with fresh ideas, and then let the painting replace your ideas with its ideas.
quotes.author: Walter Darby Bannard

quotes.quote: We can't change anything until we get some fresh ideas, until we begin to see things differently.
quotes.author: James Hillman

quotes.quote: Regardless of how badly you handled yesterday, today provides a fresh opportunity to do things right!
quotes.author: Richard Blackaby

quotes.quote: You have to stay fresh and blank in your mind when you go out to bat. You complicate things, and you're gone.
quotes.author: Virat Kohli

quotes.quote: My life's purpose is to write poetry - but behind the poetry must be the vision of a fresh revelation for men.
quotes.author: William Soutar

quotes.quote: The greatest power you possess in life is your understanding that life gives you a fresh start any moment you choose.
quotes.author: Guy Finley

quotes.quote: Living indoors without fresh air quickly poisons the blood and makes people feel tired and seedy when they don't know why. For myself, I sleep out of doors in winter as well as summer. I only feel tired or seedy when I have been indoors a lot. I only catch cold when I sleep in a room.
quotes.author: Robert Baden-Powell

quotes.quote: I love the feeling of the fresh air on my face and the wind blowing through my hair.
quotes.author: Evel Knievel

quotes.quote: Fresh air is as good for the mind as for the body. Nature always seems trying to talk to us as if she had some great secret to tell. And so she has.
quotes.author: John Lubbock

quotes.quote: I could never stay long enough on the shore; the tang of the untainted, fresh, and free sea air was like a cool, quieting thought.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Fresh air is good if you do not take too much of it; most of the achievements and pleasures of life are in bad air.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendall Holmes

quotes.quote: I love hiking in the mountains in Aspen. Breathing the clean, fresh air is great. Plus, it gives me a cardiovascular workout and firms my legs.
quotes.author: Chris Evert

quotes.quote: Fresh air and exercise. That's all you need to stay slim and feel better about life.
quotes.author: Kaitie Hopkins

quotes.quote: There are some people who walk into a room and they oxygenate it, by their very being there's fresh air. Then there are those who come in with the smell of death and they suck the life out.
quotes.author: Peter Mullan

quotes.quote: You can't change who you are, but you can change what you have in your head, you can refresh what you're thinking about, you can put some fresh air in your brain.
quotes.author: Ernesto Bertarelli

quotes.quote: Some old-fashioned things like fresh air and sunshine are hard to beat.
quotes.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quotes.quote: An open mind is like an open window. It lets the fresh air in.
quotes.author: Mike Hernacki

quotes.quote: By all means never fail to get all the sunshine and fresh air you can.
quotes.author: Joseph Pilates

quotes.quote: Unexpected change can be like a breath of fresh air a little brisk at first, but magic for the body and soul.
quotes.author: Susan Wiggs

quotes.quote: It might be hard to believe, but the air in prison is different. There's like one thousand people sucking on the one little piece of fresh air until it turns stale.
quotes.author: Sister Souljah

quotes.quote: There is nothing like the cure of fresh air for cases of bladder infection, paranoia, and Cartesian thinking.
quotes.author: Rawi Hage

quotes.quote: Anyone's life truly lived consists of work, sunshine, exercise, soap, plenty of fresh air, and a happy contented spirit.
quotes.author: Lillie Langtry

quotes.quote: If we do not own the freshness of the air and the sparkle of the water, how can you buy them?
quotes.author: Chief Seattle

quotes.quote: Be thankful for a breath of fresh air to be alive and well. Allow love and happiness to penetrate throughout your mind and soul. Take time to relax and live in the moment, the now, the present. Enjoy today.
quotes.author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana

quotes.quote: I have a massage when I want to relax. I love being pampered. I love island massages when you're outside in the fresh air.
quotes.author: Angie Stone

quotes.quote: Open the window of your mind. Allow the fresh air,new lights and new truths to enter.
quotes.author: Amit Ray

quotes.quote: Fridays are the hardest in some ways: you're so close to freedom.
quotes.author: Lauren Oliver

quotes.quote: If my boss knew how unproductive I am on Fridays, he wouldn't want me here either.
quotes.author: James Johnson

quotes.quote: For most Americans, Friday afternoons are filled with positive anticipation of the weekend. In Washington, it's where government officials dump stories they want to bury.
quotes.author: John Sununu

quotes.quote: Employers are at their happiest on Mondays. Employees are at their happiest on Fridays.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: Friday is like a superhero that always arrives just in time to stop me from savagely beating one of my coworkers with a keyboard.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: There is a vast world of work out there in this country, where at least 111 million people are employed in this country alone—many of whom are bored out of their minds. All day long. Not for nothing is their motto TGIF —'Thank God It's Friday.' They live for the weekends, when they can go do what they really want to do.
quotes.author: Richard Nelson Bolles

quotes.quote: Youth is like a long weekend on Friday night. Middle age is like a long weekend on Monday afternoon.
quotes.author: Richard Nelson Bolles

quotes.quote: Make a Friday a day to celebrate work well done that you can be proud of knowing that you just didn't put in time to the next pay check.
quotes.author: Byron Pulsifer

quotes.quote: If you must have motivation, think of your paycheck on Friday.
quotes.author: Noel Coward

quotes.quote: It's Friday...any plan of being a productive member of society is officially thrown out the window.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Welcome to Friday. In preparation for takeoff, please ensure all negative attitudes are properly stowed. On behalf of your captain, Jack Daniels and myself, welcome aboard. I expect sunshine and good attitudes today for our trip. Enjoy the ride.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I always give 100% at work: 13% Monday, 22% Tuesday, 26% Wednesday, 35% Thursday, 4% Friday. Welcome back weekend.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Friday. The golden child of the weekdays. The superhero of the workweek. The welcome wagon to the weekend. The famous F word we thank God for every week.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Dear Monday, I want to break up. I'm seeing Tuesday and dreaming about Friday. Sincerely, It's not me, It's you.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: It's always difficult to keep Fridays confined within themselves..they tend to spill over..
quotes.author: Kai Sinclair

quotes.quote: Things people say: It's Friday! Things self-employed people say: It's Friday?
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Thursday doesn't even count as a day, it's just the thing that's blocking friday.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: If you're playing World of Warcraft on a Friday night & you put your ear up to your monitor, it sounds exactly like having no friends.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: My boss yelled at me yesterday 'It's the fifth time you've been late to work this week! Do you know what that means!?' I said, 'Probably that it's Friday?'
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I'm so sad it's Friday. I wish it was Monday already' said No one in history, ever.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I know every day is a gift, but where's the receipt for Mondays? I want to exchange it for another Friday.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Waiting for the fish to bite or waiting for wind to fly a kite. Or waiting around for Friday night or waiting perhaps for their Uncle Jake or a pot to boil or a better break or a string of pearls or a pair of pants or a wig with curls or another chance. Everyone is just waiting.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.quote: Your hair may be brushed, but your mind's untidy. You've had about seven hours of sleep since Friday. No wonder you feel that lost sensation. You're sunk from a riot of relaxation.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: Why is Monday so far away from Friday but Friday is so close to Monday?
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Some days are commonly deemed unlucky; among others Friday labours under that opprobrium; and it is pretty generally held that no new work or enterprise should commence on that day.
quotes.author: John Brand

quotes.quote: It was a nice day to remember, to gather those scattered Friday nights of candles over childhood's inconsistent terrain.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Ehrlich

quotes.quote: And Friday, my dear Friday, died of measles, 17 years ago come March.
quotes.author: John Bartlett

quotes.quote: Travel into any Texas town on any Friday night in Autumn and you'll witness the populace undergoing something akin to a religious experience at the local stadium.
quotes.author: Alan Burton

quotes.quote: We in Texas have to decide. do we want our kids to entertain us on Friday nights at football games, or do we want them to be winners for the rest of their lives?
quotes.author: Ros Perot

quotes.quote: The housewife should kindle tha Sabbath candles with a joyous heart and goodwill, for it is a great privilege accorded to her.
quotes.author: Zohar

quotes.quote: Now, Saturday and Sunday are called weekends, and they're pretty good but the best day of all is Friday.
quotes.author: Daniel McCoy

quotes.quote: Midst of wealth of facts and fancies / That our memory may recall / Thus the old-school day romances / Are the dearest after all! / When some sweet thought revises / The half-forgotten tune / That opened 'exercises' / On 'Friday afternoon.'
quotes.author: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.quote: When my town shall fade into the abyss of time, I will continue to remember the light and the warmth it radiated on Shabbat
quotes.author: Elie Wiesel

quotes.quote: They have three Sundays a week in Tangier. the Muhammadans' comes on Friday, the Jews' on Saturday, and that of the Christian Consuls on Sunday.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Solomon Grundy, born on a Monday / Christened on Tuesday, married on Wednesday / Took ill on Thursday, worse on Friday/ Died on Saturday, buried on Sunday: This is the end of Solomon Grundy.
quotes.author: Iona Opie and Peter Opie

quotes.quote: You know that Munday is Sundayes brother / Tuesday is such another / Wednesday you must go to church and pray / Thursday is half-holiday / On Friday it is too late to begin to spin / The Saturday is half-holiday agen.
quotes.author: John Brand

quotes.quote: Although many believe the Friday after Thanksgiving is the busiest shopping day of the year, it is not. It is the fifth to tenth busiest.
quotes.author: Lawrence Dorfman

quotes.quote: Good Friday in my heart! Fear and affright! / My thoughts are the Disciples when they fled, / My words the words that priest and soldier said.
quotes.author: Mary Elizabeth Coleridge

quotes.quote: The days sped slowly; but the Friday came / And flocked the miners to the shooting-ground / They chose six riflemen of deadly aim / And with low voices sat and lounged around.
quotes.author: John Boyle O'Reilly

quotes.quote: One long Good Friday 'twas, one heartache drear / But may my mistress' Advent ever prove / With its palm-jubilee, so sweet and glad / One endless Mayday, through the livelong year!
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: I missed your embrace / Seven lonely days / There are so many kisses due / Friday night.
quotes.author: Arabesque

quotes.quote: I hope and I pray / You will say one day / That our love is not only for / Friday night.
quotes.author: Arabesque

quotes.quote: Fridays never swing the same / That's what makes it so charming / where is it heading to / Oh what are we gonna do.
quotes.author: Nicole Ewang Congwe

quotes.quote: It's Friday night and I got stacks / The club was crunk, jammed packed / Mrs. Bartender what drink is that / T-Pain Buy a Drink playin' in the back.
quotes.author: Raheem Davaughn

quotes.quote: It's finally Friday I'm free again / I got my motor running for a wild weekend / It's finally Friday I'm out of control / Forget the workin' blues / And let the good times roll.
quotes.author: Bobby K. Boyd

quotes.quote: Every Friday, I like to high five myself for getting through another week on little more than caffeine, will power, and inappropriate humor.
quotes.author: Nanea Hoffman

quotes.quote: Friday is a day to finish your goals for the week. It is a day to celebrate that which you set out to accomplish at the beginning of the week.
quotes.author: Byron Pulsifer

quotes.quote: Weekends are life’s gift to those who hate their jobs.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: People wait all week for Friday, all year for summer, all life for happiness.
quotes.author: Raimonda B.

quotes.quote: Truth is everybody is going to hurt you: you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: Life is a gamble. You can get hurt, but people die in plane crashes, lose their arms and legs in car accidents; people die every day. Same with fighters: some die, some get hurt, some go on. You just don't let yourself believe it will happen to you.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: Two things scare me. The first is getting hurt. But that's not nearly as scary as the second, which is losing.
quotes.author: Lance Armstrong

quotes.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
quotes.author: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.quote: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.quote: To hurt is as human as to breathe.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.quote: I don't want to hurt you or anybody so please forget about me. Just try. Find yourself a better friend.
quotes.author: Nina LaCour

quotes.quote: I still own my heart, which I know because it hurts so much.
quotes.author: Emilie Autumn

quotes.quote: It hurts so bad to be ignored or rejected by that only person who means the world to you.
quotes.author: Tshepo Koos Maluleke

quotes.quote: You will never know the power of yourself until someone hurts you badly.
quotes.author: Varsha Sharma

quotes.quote: If they keep hurting you, love them and stay or love yourself and leave.
quotes.author: Sonya Parker

quotes.quote: I hope some day you realize what you meant to me. You were my everything while I was your nothing. You threw me away like trash the way she'll do you.
quotes.author: Karina Barton

quotes.quote: Sometimes someone can hurt us more than we really deserve because we had loved them more than they actually deserve.
quotes.author: Anurag Prakash Ray

quotes.quote: To live is to hurt others, and through others, to hurt oneself. Cruel earth! How can we manage not to touch anything? To find what ultimate exile?
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The stroke of death is as a lover's pinch, Which hurts and is desired.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: That old saying, how you always hurt the one you love, well, it works both ways.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: Love, to be real, must cost - it must hurt - it must empty us of self.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: On Friday the 13th weird things are supposed to happen ... Maybe I'll get in to a relationship.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Its Friday the 13th! It's only bad luck if you put it in your head. Think its just another day & stay positive. Have faith with God!
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Don't be superstitious. Nothing will happen on Friday the 13th that cannot happen on Saturday the 14th.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Don't walk under any ladders, Don't break any mirrors, Don't spill any salt, And don't walk by any black cats. Happy Friday the 13th!
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: FACT : Friday the 13th happens 3 times this year, each 13 weeks apart from the other. This hasn't happened since 1984. Happy Friday the 13th.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Fear of Friday the 13th one of the most popular myths in science is called paraskavedekatriaphobia as well as friggatriskaidekaphobia. Triskaidekaphobia is fear of the number 13.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt would not travel on the 13th day of any month and would never host 13 guests at a meal. Napoleon and President Herbert Hoover were also triskaidekaphobic, with an abnormal fear of the number 13.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Superstitious diners in Paris can hire a quatorzieme, or professional 14th guest.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Every month that begins on a sunday has a friday the 13th
quotes.author: Auliq Ice

quotes.quote: Ever wonder what the big deal is about this silly date? We did. It turns out the history of Friday the 13th is complicated. There are superstitions about Friday, superstitions about the number 13--which together seem to create the fear of Friday the 13th. Most of these superstitions are rooted in religion.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Some historians have claimed it was the day on which Eve bit the apple from the Tree of Knowledge, the great flood began and the builders of the Tower of Babel.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: In Somerset, it is said that whoever turns a bed on a Friday turns ships at sea. In Cumberland, babies born on a Friday were laid on the family Bible.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Calling a doctor for the first time on a Friday is a certain omen of death.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Don't walk under a ladder. A leaning ladder supposedly represents the trinity-walk right through it, and you're in league with the devil.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Don't open umbrellas indoors, at least if you don't want to upset the sun gods.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Walk away from that black cat. It's evil. Cats were believed to be the familiars of witches in the middle ages.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: It is unlucky to have thirteen at a table or in a company. The number 13, in the Christian faith, is the number of people at the Last Supper, with the 13th guest at the table being the traitor, Judas.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Christians consider Friday as the day on which Christ was crucified by the Romans.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: If you cut your hair on Friday the 13th, someone in your family will die.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: The belief that Friday the 13th is an unlucky day is believed to stem from two fears-the fear of 13 being an unlucky number and the fear of Fridays.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Do not start a new job or business on Friday the 13th, it will be followed by collapse or bankrupt.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: The full moon of June will fall on Friday the 13th. This is a very rare event, the next time a full moon will fall on Friday the 13th will be 2049.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: I'm not nearly as afraid of Friday the 13th as I am of the people who are afraid of Friday the 13th.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Superstition is foolish, childish, primitive, and irrational-but how much does it cost you to knock on wood?
quotes.author: Judith Viorst

quotes.quote: Tomorrow is Friday the 13th. It's gonna be another blessed day for God's people, just like every other day.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Very superstitious, writings on the wall, very superstitious, ladders 'bout to fall, Thirteen month old baby, broke the lookin' glass, seven years of bad luck, the good things in your past.
quotes.author: Stevie Wonder

quotes.quote: It's Friday the 13th. Just warning you all before you make any weekend arangements for wood cabins by lake.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Happy friday the 13th! Don't look what's under your bed tonight & don't turn off the light. You don't know what's coming. Have a good day!
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Its Friday the 13, you scared? Go to church.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Superstition is the religion of feeble minds.
quotes.author: Burke

quotes.quote: In reality, there's no such thing as bad luck. Friday the 13th is just a day like any other day.
quotes.author: Michael Feldman

quotes.quote: If so, consider yourself lucky. But beware until midnight; it is still Friday the 13th.
quotes.author: Jack King

quotes.quote: Friday the 13th is quickly becoming my least favorite day of the year.
quotes.author: Ashley Tisdale

quotes.quote:
Every day is Friday the 13th with bad luck
Somehow we made it through, don't know how, somehow we do.
quotes.author: Twiztid

quotes.quote: Friday the 13th that's the day that hell raised.
quotes.author: Lil Wayne

quotes.quote: On Friday the 13th I always used to wonder what that means but now I think that I finally see.
quotes.author: Nikhil

quotes.quote: The belief that Friday 13th is an especially unlucky day is one of the widest known superstitions in Britain today and is erroneously assumed to be of great antiquity.
quotes.author: Steve Roud

quotes.quote: The notion that Thirteen is a generally unlucky number has not been found earlier than 1852. Fridays, however have been regarded as unlucky since medieval times.
quotes.author: Steve Roud

quotes.quote: Friday cut and Sunday shorn / Better never have been born.
quotes.author: Lancashire N&Q (1870)

quotes.quote: In the 19th century, the fears of Friday and of the number 13 came together.
quotes.author: C.M. Johnson

quotes.quote: The fear of Friday the 13th is called friggatriskaidekaphobia. The word comes from Frigga, the Norse goddess for whom Friday is named, and triskaidekaphobia, the fear of the number 13.
quotes.author: C.M. Johnson

quotes.quote: And on a Friday fell all this mischance.
quotes.author: Chaucer

quotes.quote: This day of the week is regarded of evil augury because it was the day (Good Friday) when our Saviour's blood was shed.
quotes.author: Lancashire Harland & Wilkinson (1882)

quotes.quote: Friday the 13th has only been scary for about a hundred years when somebody got the brilliant idea of combining their fear of 13 with their fear of Fridays.
quotes.author: Gregory Korgesky PhD

quotes.quote: People may avoid anything related to the number 13 because they are convinced it's bad luck.
quotes.author: Gregory Korgesky PhD

quotes.quote: Some say that the fear of 13 has its origin in the Last Supper story, where Judas Iscariot makes up the unlucky 13th dinner.
quotes.author: Gregory Korgesky PhD

quotes.quote: Some days are commonly deemed unlucky among others, Friday labours under that opprobrium; and it is pretty generally held that no new work or enterprise should commence on that day.
quotes.author: John Brand

quotes.quote: It's bad luck to begin work on Fridays.
quotes.author: Southern Mothers

quotes.quote: Your turn comes on Friday, so think about it.
quotes.author: Irma Grese

quotes.quote: A black cat crossing your path signifies that the animal is going somewhere.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Friday 13th is only bad luck if you choose it to be.
quotes.author: Denise Mansfield

quotes.quote: Every month that begins on a Sunday has a Friday as the 13th.
quotes.author: Auliq Ice

quotes.quote: Think of how dark that Friday was when Christ was lifted up on the cross... It was a Friday filled with devastating, consuming sorrow that gnawed at the souls of those who loved and honored the Son of God.
quotes.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

quotes.quote: Bury the dead. Say Robinson Crusoe was true to life. Well, then Friday buried him. Every Friday buries a Thursday if you come to look at it.
quotes.author: James Joyce

quotes.quote: It’s not bad enough to have Friday the 13th, we've gotta have a full moon too. We keep statistics. We have more accidents, more rapes, more robberies, more homicides, more of everything when there’s a full moon. It upsets people. Makes them nuts.
quotes.author: Friday the 13th

quotes.quote: The dripping blood our only drink, The bloody flesh our only food: In spite of which we like to think That we are sound, substantial flesh and blood Again, in spite of that, we call this Friday good.
quotes.author: T.S. Eliot

quotes.quote: If you believed in Christianity or Islam it was called 'faith', but if you believed in astrology or Friday the thirteenth it was Superstition!
quotes.author: Jostein Gaarder

quotes.quote: What has always puzzled me is the flexibility of God's word. For instance, Catholics can now eat meat on Fridays. And limbo has been abolished. How does this work? Who tells them?
quotes.author: Simon Hoggart

quotes.quote: On Friday the 13th, April 2029, an asteroid large enough to fill the Rose Bowl as though it were an egg cup will fly so close to Earth that it will dip below the altitude of our communication satellites. We did not name this asteroid Bambi. Instead, we named it Apophis, after the Egyptian god of darkness and death.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.quote: I'm like an eclipse on a Friday the 13th, With black cats and Haley's Comet, Blazin' blunts in my driveway.
quotes.author: Redman

quotes.quote: This was the best date I’d ever been on. And it wasn’t even a date.
quotes.author: Abby Jimenez

quotes.quote: Love is blind friendship closes its eyes.
quotes.author: Neera Kapur Badhwar

quotes.quote: The friend becomes a traitor by breaking, however unwillingly or sadly, out of our own zone. A hard judgement is passed on him, for all the pleas of the heart.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quotes.quote: Should I smile because we are friends? Or cry because we'll never be anything more?
quotes.author: Latifah Bates

quotes.quote: Always a boyfriend, never a boyfriend.
quotes.author: Christian Simamora

quotes.quote: Even now I'll see her looking at him, her eyes milky yet full of longing, and all he ever gives her is a gentle, absent nod. Perhaps this is the nature of true deprivation a lifetime of love, tenderly spurned.
quotes.author: Jane Avrich

quotes.quote: Friendzone teenage purgatory like a mirage of an oasis in a sweltering desert when they're happy it brightens the world when they're sad Your world erodes when you look at them you see utter brilliance magnificence perfectness but when they see you they only see one thing: Friend
quotes.author: Marshall Wagoner

quotes.quote: There is boy friend and then there is boyfriend that tiny little space is known as the friend zone. Dont get it twisted.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: I've often liked a girl, made her laugh, and thought she liked me, and then found out that she didn't like me that way. I've definitely done time in the friend zone.
quotes.author: Demetri Martin

quotes.quote: The heart may think it knows better: the senses know that absence blots people out. We really have no absent friends. The friend becomes a traitor by breaking, however unwillingly or sadly, out of our own zone: a hard judgment is passed on him, for all the pleas of the heart.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quotes.quote: I think once you're in the friend zone, I'm not sure how you get out. Well, actually, I do know how you get out. You act like the friend back. That's how you get out.
quotes.author: Emma Roberts

quotes.quote: Even among familiar faces, people often feel invisible and desolate, like an island in cold waters or a shadow apart from the crowd. Be the reason another never feels alone.
quotes.author: Richelle E. Goodrich

quotes.quote: Nobody enjoys the company of others as intensely as someone who usually avoids the company of others.
quotes.author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.quote: I care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.quote: Friendless. Having no favors to bestow. Destitute of fortune. Addicted to utterance of truth and common sense.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: In proportion as my own discomfort has increased, my conviction of necessity to search into the wants of the friendless and afflicted has deepened. If I am cold, they too are cold; if I am weary, they are distressed; if I am alone, they are abandoned.
quotes.author: Dorothea Dix

quotes.quote: The cayote is a living, breathing allegory of Want. He is always hungry. He is always poor, out of luck and friendless. The meanest creatures despise him, and even the fleas would desert him for a velocipede.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: We become strong, I feel, when we have no friends upon whom to lean, or to look to for moral guidance.
quotes.author: Benito Mussolini

quotes.quote: If you are looking for a friend who is faultless, you will be friendless.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.quote: There is no man so friendless but what he can find a friend sincere enough to tell him disagreeable truths.
quotes.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quotes.quote: No one would choose a friendless existence on condition of having all other things in the world.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: I'd rather be a friendless loser, than have a bunch of friends who secretly hate me.
quotes.author: Massie Block

quotes.quote: I have no friends.The more you learn about the difgnity of the gorilla, the more you want to avoid people.
quotes.author: Dian Fossey

quotes.quote: A man who seeks a perfect friend, will remain friendless.
quotes.author: Turkish Proverb

quotes.quote: Come, let us pity those who are better off than we are. Come, my friend, and remember that the rich have butlers and no friends, And we have friends and no butlers.
quotes.author: Ezra Pound

quotes.quote: It's hard, but sometimes it is better to have no friends for a time than to have the wrong friends. The wrong group can lead you down all kinds of paths you really don't want to be on. And retracing your steps can be a long and hard journey.
quotes.author: Sean Covey

quotes.quote: Being friendless taught me how to be a friend. Funny how that works.
quotes.author: Colleen Wainwright

quotes.quote: If I were hungry and friendless today, I would rather take my chances with a saloon-keeper than with the average preacher.
quotes.author: Eugene V. Debs

quotes.quote: I found, increasingly, that I did not particularly care and I tried to fake a little kindness, a little sweetness, tried to mirror Luna back at herself, but that exhausted me after a week and I concluded that I was not meant for this sort of thing, friends, friendliness, no, I wasn't meant for it.
quotes.author: Catherine Lacey

quotes.quote: We were not as close as you might expect; we were equally friendless and equally scorned, and we eyed each other with the same suspicion with which we viewed the rest of the world.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Strout

quotes.quote: Do not despair. To be friendless is indeed to be unfortunate, but the hearts of men, when unprejudiced by any obvious self-interest, are full of brotherly love and charity.
quotes.author: Mary Shelley

quotes.quote: No man can be called friendless who has God and the companionship of good books.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quotes.quote: It is one thing to be sick of your own infirmities and another to understand that the people you love most are sick of them also. You are very near then to being friendless in the world.
quotes.author: Leif Enger

quotes.quote: But what if I did tell people exactly what was going on? What if I valued my own peace of mind more than what other people think of me? Would I end up jobless, friendless, and loveless? Would I vanish entirely?
